title: Last Drop: December’s Best Beauty Launches
description: Gift yourself the latest and the greatest from brands like Glow Recipe, Merit, and Sol de Janeiro.
excerpt: Gift yourself the latest and the greatest from brands like Trudon, Glow Recipe, and Sol de Janeiro.
text: Welcome to Last Drop, where you can discover the newest and buzziest beauty launches hitting shelves near you.Trudon Fir Classic Candle“I look forward to Trudon’s holiday candles every year, and this year did not disappoint,” says Katie Berohn, ELLE’s beauty editor. “Fir is a cozy, woodsy scent that isn’t too Christmas-y—you wouldn’t walk into my apartment and think I’m marathoning Hallmark movies. The gold leaf interior is a nice touch, too.”Glow Recipe Cloudberry Bright Refillable Cream MoisturizerPowered by antioxidant-rich cloudberry seed oil, Glow Recipe’s new moisturizer is designed to brighten and plump the skin day and night. “With its buttery texture and brightening formulation, this moisturizer is great for the upcoming cold weather months,” says ELLE’s beauty director Kathleen Hou. Other hero ingredients include peptides, which smooth out fine lines and wrinkles, and CoQ10 to boost collagen. Sol de Janeiro Delícia Drench Moisturizing Shower OilOne of Sol de Janeiro’s best-selling scents is Cheirosa 59, a sweet, woody fragrance that fuses plum, vanilla orchid, and sandalwood. The body care brand has transformed the scent into a body wash—the formula applies like an oil but foams up when combined with water. As a result, it helps to hydrate the skin while also washing off dirt and debris without leaving an uncomfortable residue behind. And, of course, the warm notes of Cheirosa 59 linger on the skin long after you’ve stepped out of the shower.Glossier Shadow StickGlossier, whose makeup products are known for their ease of use, has unveiled its latest creation: Its first eyeshadow crayons. These sticks are so creamy that you can just scribble them on your eyelid and blend them out with your fingers (or a brush, depending on what you’re comfortable with). Sadly, they’re limited-edition, so those who are interested should snap them up before they’re gone.Drunk Elephant Therabu Buttered Reparative Hand CreamWinter winds are not very kind to our hands, but a layer of nourishing hand cream can protect the skin from painful cracking and prevent any roughness. “This time of year, my hands get unbelievably dry,” shares Berohn. “This hand cream feels silky and sinks in easily while making my skin feel incredibly hydrated. It makes my hands feel like I just got a paraffin wax treatment without doing anything.”Merit x Completedworks The Organic Silver Pearl Drop EarringsLooking for a non-perishable gift for the beauty lover in your life? I’d suggest looking into these earrings, a collaboration between jewelry and ceramics brand Completedworks and beauty company Merit. The limited-edition jewelry combines sterling silver and freshwater pearls for an asymmetric look that feels like a cool and fresh take on the timeless pearl earring. I, for one, will be wearing them all throughout the holidays and beyond.The Maker Dream Eau de ParfumWe’ve seen milk-inspired fragrances as well as cream-inspired ones. Perfumers’s next dairy-related muse? Butter. The Maker has dreamed up a creamy, decadent perfume that’s like catnip for gourmand lovers. It’s warm, it’s sweet, and it’s slightly smoky—kind of like enjoying hot, fresh-out-the-oven cinnamon rolls by a crackling fireplace.Isamaya x Conserving Beauty Hyaluronic Cleansing ClothsThis collaboration between makeup company Isamaya and skin care brand Conserving Beauty aims to be a multi-purpose product in your routine—you can use it to prep your skin for makeup, or you can employ it to remove your makeup at the end of a long day. “These are not the cleansing cloths you buy when the airline loses all your luggage,” shares Hou. “Specially developed by makeup artist Isamaya Ffrench, these makeup wipes work to remove all the dirt, oil, and grime off your face, but are also formulated to be gentle enough for kids’ bottoms. Plus, it comes in a sleek silver pill-like vessel and utilizes Conserving Beauty’s world-first InstaMelt dissolving technology, so the wipes dissolve with water.” They boast hydrating and nourishing ingredients like hyaluronic acid, panthenol, and niacinamide.Cotton x D.S. & Durga The Cool Calm Cotton SetAs the year comes to a close, it’s finally time to relax and unwind after what I’m sure was a stressful year. Here to help is Cotton Incorporated and D.S. & Durga, two brands that worked together to launch the Cool Calm Cotton Set—a 100 percent cotton blanket infused with the scent of D.S. & Durga’s calming Wild Brooklyn Lavender fragrance. If you’d like to switch out the scent, you can stick another one of the perfumery’s auto fragrance cards into the tag, which also serves as a pocket. Anna Sui Wild Wonder Collection Dew Fields Eau de ParfumAnna Sui’s newest fragrance drop smells like stepping into a rose garden drenched in dew. “Roses are a constant motif in Sui’s designs and her beauty creations,” says Hou. “Her new Wild Wonders collection features five new scents, including this green tea rose scent, which smells like morning humidity: Earthy, clean, and still fresh.”Arquiste Little PawsHave you ever sniffed a dog’s paw? In case you haven’t, let me describe it for you—it usually smells like slightly musky tortilla chips. If you’re not an animal person, you might balk at that description, but if you’re a fellow dog lover, you probably smiled in recognition. Plus anyone in the latter category will love this candle from Arquiste, which is dedicated to all of our furry friends and pays tribute to their precious paws with the scent of musk, corn chips, and popcorn.Mara Sea Silk Lip Balm in Toasty RougeMara’s beloved lip treatment, which deeply moisturizes the lips with fruit-derived butters and oils, now also comes in a juicy red shade. “I normally always wear matte red lipstick to pull any outfit I have together, but lately, I’ve been gravitating more toward glosses and balms,” shares Berohn. “I’m going to be honest, most red-toned glosses are too pink-leaning for my tastes, which is why I never really wear them. This one is actually red, and it looks gorgeous while also moisturizing lips.”Jovan I Want You To Want Me Eau de ParfumMusk is one of those notes that smells good on everyone—after all, it’s like an earthy, sexy replica of the scent of skin—and it holds the starring role in this new perfume. “This name is honestly quite fitting for this ultra-alluring fragrance. It’s just the right balance of musk, pink pepper, and rose—perfect for your next date night,” says Berohn.
html:
Welcome to Last Drop, where you can discover the newest and buzziest beauty launches hitting shelves near you.

Trudon Fir Classic Candle

“I look forward to Trudon’s holiday candles every year, and this year did not disappoint,” says Katie Berohn, ELLE’s beauty editor. “Fir is a cozy, woodsy scent that isn’t too Christmas-y—you wouldn’t walk into my apartment and think I’m marathoning Hallmark movies. The gold leaf interior is a nice touch, too.”

Glow Recipe Cloudberry Bright Refillable Cream Moisturizer

Powered by antioxidant-rich cloudberry seed oil, Glow Recipe’s new moisturizer is designed to brighten and plump the skin day and night. “With its buttery texture and brightening formulation, this moisturizer is great for the upcoming cold weather months,” says ELLE’s beauty director Kathleen Hou. Other hero ingredients include peptides, which smooth out fine lines and wrinkles, and CoQ10 to boost collagen.

Sol de Janeiro Delícia Drench Moisturizing Shower Oil

One of Sol de Janeiro’s best-selling scents is Cheirosa 59, a sweet, woody fragrance that fuses plum, vanilla orchid, and sandalwood. The body care brand has transformed the scent into a body wash—the formula applies like an oil but foams up when combined with water. As a result, it helps to hydrate the skin while also washing off dirt and debris without leaving an uncomfortable residue behind. And, of course, the warm notes of Cheirosa 59 linger on the skin long after you’ve stepped out of the shower.

Glossier Shadow Stick

Glossier, whose makeup products are known for their ease of use, has unveiled its latest creation: Its first eyeshadow crayons. These sticks are so creamy that you can just scribble them on your eyelid and blend them out with your fingers (or a brush, depending on what you’re comfortable with). Sadly, they’re limited-edition, so those who are interested should snap them up before they’re gone.

Drunk Elephant Therabu Buttered Reparative Hand Cream

Winter winds are not very kind to our hands, but a layer of nourishing hand cream can protect the skin from painful cracking and prevent any roughness. “This time of year, my hands get unbelievably dry,” shares Berohn. “This hand cream feels silky and sinks in easily while making my skin feel incredibly hydrated. It makes my hands feel like I just got a paraffin wax treatment without doing anything.”

Merit x Completedworks The Organic Silver Pearl Drop Earrings

Looking for a non-perishable gift for the beauty lover in your life? I’d suggest looking into these earrings, a collaboration between jewelry and ceramics brand Completedworks and beauty company Merit. The limited-edition jewelry combines sterling silver and freshwater pearls for an asymmetric look that feels like a cool and fresh take on the timeless pearl earring. I, for one, will be wearing them all throughout the holidays and beyond.

The Maker Dream Eau de Parfum

We’ve seen milk-inspired fragrances as well as cream-inspired ones. Perfumers’s next dairy-related muse? Butter. The Maker has dreamed up a creamy, decadent perfume that’s like catnip for gourmand lovers. It’s warm, it’s sweet, and it’s slightly smoky—kind of like enjoying hot, fresh-out-the-oven cinnamon rolls by a crackling fireplace.

Isamaya x Conserving Beauty Hyaluronic Cleansing Cloths

This collaboration between makeup company Isamaya and skin care brand Conserving Beauty aims to be a multi-purpose product in your routine—you can use it to prep your skin for makeup, or you can employ it to remove your makeup at the end of a long day. “These are not the cleansing cloths you buy when the airline loses all your luggage,” shares Hou. “Specially developed by makeup artist Isamaya Ffrench, these makeup wipes work to remove all the dirt, oil, and grime off your face, but are also formulated to be gentle enough for kids’ bottoms. Plus, it comes in a sleek silver pill-like vessel and utilizes Conserving Beauty’s world-first InstaMelt dissolving technology, so the wipes dissolve with water.” They boast hydrating and nourishing ingredients like hyaluronic acid, panthenol, and niacinamide.

Cotton x D.S. & Durga The Cool Calm Cotton Set

As the year comes to a close, it’s finally time to relax and unwind after what I’m sure was a stressful year. Here to help is Cotton Incorporated and D.S. & Durga, two brands that worked together to launch the Cool Calm Cotton Set—a 100 percent cotton blanket infused with the scent of D.S. & Durga’s calming Wild Brooklyn Lavender fragrance. If you’d like to switch out the scent, you can stick another one of the perfumery’s auto fragrance cards into the tag, which also serves as a pocket.

Anna Sui Wild Wonder Collection Dew Fields Eau de Parfum

Anna Sui’s newest fragrance drop smells like stepping into a rose garden drenched in dew. “Roses are a constant motif in Sui’s designs and her beauty creations,” says Hou. “Her new Wild Wonders collection features five new scents, including this green tea rose scent, which smells like morning humidity: Earthy, clean, and still fresh.”

Arquiste Little Paws

Have you ever sniffed a dog’s paw? In case you haven’t, let me describe it for you—it usually smells like slightly musky tortilla chips. If you’re not an animal person, you might balk at that description, but if you’re a fellow dog lover, you probably smiled in recognition. Plus anyone in the latter category will love this candle from Arquiste, which is dedicated to all of our furry friends and pays tribute to their precious paws with the scent of musk, corn chips, and popcorn.

Mara Sea Silk Lip Balm in Toasty Rouge

Mara’s beloved lip treatment, which deeply moisturizes the lips with fruit-derived butters and oils, now also comes in a juicy red shade. “I normally always wear matte red lipstick to pull any outfit I have together, but lately, I’ve been gravitating more toward glosses and balms,” shares Berohn. “I’m going to be honest, most red-toned glosses are too pink-leaning for my tastes, which is why I never really wear them. This one is actually red, and it looks gorgeous while also moisturizing lips.”

Jovan I Want You To Want Me Eau de Parfum

Musk is one of those notes that smells good on everyone—after all, it’s like an earthy, sexy replica of the scent of skin—and it holds the starring role in this new perfume. “This name is honestly quite fitting for this ultra-alluring fragrance. It’s just the right balance of musk, pink pepper, and rose—perfect for your next date night,” says Berohn.
